author: sky.cactus
content:
<@273808422753796097> The way I think about it is that miners have "something at stake" right now because they have hardware that is worth $X per operational time without Ethereum PoW mining and it is worth $Y per operational time with Ethereum PoW mining where `Y ~= 4X` right now.  At the moment, their hardware's value amortized over its life is `(x + y) * lifespan`.  One block before the merge, it is worth `x * lifespan + 2eth * share_of_hashing_power`.

This means that one block before the merge they effectively have epsilon "stake" in Ethereum's long term success.  Right now a miner with a 4 year amortization on hardware has something like `(2eth * 16,000,000blocks * share_of_hashing_power - y) * lifespan` (caveats here for PoS launch coming before their hardware reaches end of life) at stake in the future success of Ethereum.

author: sky.cactus
content: Of important note here is that `32,000,000 ETH` is substantially greater than `2 ETH`.  ðŸ™‚

author: sky.cactus
content: So miners *will* mine right up to the last minute, but they have no reason to *not* collude to attack Ethereum, or rent their hashing power out to someone who they *know* is going to attack Ethereum.  Right now they have 32M ETH worth of reason to *not* collude with an attacker in a way that will damage Ethereum's future value.

content: I can think of plenty of different ways to do it, I personally think its premature to go into much detail until it's clear that anyone is even interested in it. The technical details are ultimately less important than the social signals here anyway. But basic idea is knowing that incentives insist that there will be an oppositional fork, set up the simplest minimum viable "friendly" fork to kill the antagonistic movements before they even start. author: timbeiko
content:
No: there is unanimous agreement in the community about ethereum's desire to go to PoS, aside from miners. Miners wanting to extend PoW/delay the merge/etc. aren't proposing a "friendly fork", they are derailing the most important roadmap item for Ethereum, and everyone in the community pays that cost. 

If miners just want to fork ethereum, remove the ice age and keep mining, they are free too, in the same way that Tron, ETC and BSC are basically just forks of Ethereum. None of these are "friendly forks", they are, at best, separate blockchains, and, at worst, freeriders on the Ethereum community's work.
